alert.note: Alert for Elmore; Montgomery; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 12:32PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL ELMORE...SOUTHWESTERN TALLAPOOSA AND NORTH CENTRAL MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 115 PM CDT... At 1231 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Boylston, or near Millbrook, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Millbrook, Wetumpka, Tallassee, Elmore, Coosada, Eclectic, Montgomery Zoo, Boylston, Martin Dam, Santuck, Bob Woodruff Lake, Reeves Airport, Emerald Mountain, Southern Lake Martin, Dexter, Lagoon Park, Alabama State University, Liberty City, and Tallapoosa City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
